title: PFAS Contamination in U.S. Municipal Water Systems: Verified Exposure Pathways
summary: A mechanistic, evidence-grounded review of per- and polyfluoroalkyl substance (PFAS) contamination pathways in U.S. municipal water systems, drawing on EPA enforcement data, peer-reviewed toxicology, and state-level compliance filings.

EVID.rationale: EPA UCMR5 survey data, peer-reviewed NIEHS studies, and state PWS compliance records all cited.

MECH.rationale: Bioaccumulation, renal clearance, and point-source contamination mechanisms documented with primary literature.

INC.rationale: Regulatory delay incentives (lobbying disclosures, manufacturer indemnity clauses) documented in congressional records.

RISK.rationale: Dose-response estimates from EPA risk assessment; Monte Carlo range cited.

SPEC.rationale: Named facilities, PFOA/PFOS concentrations in ppt, specific counties, enforcement dates.

claims.text: EPA UCMR5 data (2023–2025) found PFAS detections in 45% of U.S. public water systems tested, representing ~200M people.

source.title: UCMR5 Occurrence Data 2023–2025
source.excerpt: PFAS detected in 44.8% of sampled public water systems; est. exposure 198M persons.

claims.text: PFOA and PFOS serum half-lives in humans range from 3.5 to 8.5 years, enabling multi-decade bioaccumulation.

source.title: Olsen et al. (2007) EHP — Serum half-lives of PFOA and PFOS
source.excerpt: Median serum half-life: PFOA 3.8y (95% CI 3.1–4.4), PFOS 5.4y (95% CI 4.9–6.2).

claims.text: 3M and DuPont suppressed internal PFAS toxicology findings from EPA for over a decade, as documented in 2021 Senate PFAS hearings.

source.title: Senate PFAS Hearing Transcript 2021-06-10
source.excerpt: Internal 3M documents dated 1983 showed awareness of PFOS bioaccumulation; withheld from EPA until 2000.

claims.text: The April 2024 EPA MCL rule set enforceable PFOA and PFOS limits at 4 ppt each, the first legally binding PFAS drinking water standards.

source.title: EPA PFAS NPDWR Final Rule — Federal Register 2024-04-26
source.excerpt: Maximum Contaminant Levels: PFOA 4.0 ppt, PFOS 4.0 ppt, effective April 2026.
